newsitem.title: LEBANON: Hizbollah attack pro-Israeli militia in Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Hizbollah attack pro-Israeli militia in Lebanon.

text.p: Moslem guerrillas fired mortar bombs into 13 pro-Israeli militia outposts early on Tuesday but no casualties were reported, pro-Israeli security sources said.
They said guerrillas opened fire early in the moring into the South Lebanon Army (SLA) outposts in the western, eastern, and central sectors of Israel's south Lebanon occupation zone.

In Beirut, the pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) claimed responsibility for the attacks. A spokesman for the group said its guerrillas fired rocket-propelled grenades and mortars into SLA outposts.

Pro-Israeli militia sources also said guerrillas set off a roadside bomb near an SLA patrol in Houla in the eastern sector of the 15-km (nine-mile) -wide occupation zone. No one was hurt, the sources said.
Hizbollah guerrillas attack Israeli and SLA troops almost daily in an effort to oust them from the south Lebanon buffer zone.
